info.title: IF2LEVA3 - Preview
info.description: performis IF2LEVA3 | Interface for leva+ base, rental and workshop

parameters.name: X-Requesting-System
parameters.description: Identifying the system calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-User
parameters.description: Identifying the user calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Flow-ID
parameters.description: Optional technical ID (GUID) for call identification.

parameters.name: X-Client-Type
parameters.description: Optional technical client type for call identification.

parameters.name: searchString
parameters.description: Optional search string for looking up a record within name and searchterm fields.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return.

parameters.name: changesSinceDateTime
parameters.description:
Get all the entities which were added/edited since a specific date/time. Cannot be used together with search
parameters (searchString, accessoryId,
externalAccessoryId).

parameters.name: changesSinceChangeId
parameters.description:
Get all the entities which were added/edited since the provided changeId. Cannot be used together with search
parameters (searchString, accessoryId,
externalAccessoryId).

parameters.name: accessoryId
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by internal accessory Id. Ignores other search options if provided.

parameters.name: externalAccessoryId
parameters.description: Retrieve a specific record by external accessory Id. Ignores other search options if provided.

get.description: By passing in the appropriate options, the service searches for accessories in the system.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-System
parameters.description: Identifying the system calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Requesting-User
parameters.description: Identifying the user calling the service.

parameters.name: X-Flow-ID
parameters.description: Optional technical ID (GUId) for call identification.

requestBody.description:
New or updated accessory.
You may use your own Id.
The same data you receive from a GET is used. The change fields are not required.

put.description:
Updates an existing accessory if internal or external ID match.
Creates an accessory if neither internal or external ID is provided or no matching record could be found.

requestBody.description:
New or updated machine.
You may use your own Id.
The same data you receive from a GET is used. The change fields are not required.

put.description:
Updates an existing machine if internal or external ID match.
Creates a machine if neither internal or external ID is provided or no matching record could be found.

requestBody.description:
Submit a complete report.
Reports can not be altered by the interface after creation. Once a report is created it needs to be processed or deleted within leva+

post.description:
Submit a complete job report to leva+.
After posting a job report, it can no longer be altered by the interface. Users on the leva+ backend may further process the posted job report and updates to job reports may be received using the GET operation.

accessoryDisplayType.description:
possible type values:
- `NONE`: Accessory without identification nor quantity
- `IdENTIFICATION`: Accessory with identification
- `QUANTITY`: Accessory with quantity
accessoryDisplayType.title: AccessoryDisplayType

accessoryId.description: technical identification number of the accessory.

externalAccessoryId.description: external technical identification number of the accessory - may be used instead of AccessoryId.

active.description: is this accessory active or not.

numberOfItems.description:
the exact number of available accessories.
Required when AccessoryDisplayType is set to `QUANTITY`.

identification.description:
identification or serial number of the accessory.
Required when AccessoryDisplayType is set to `IDENTIFICATION`.

branchCode.description: C4562 identification code of the branch to which the machine belongs to.

isExternalResource.description: a value indicating whether the resource is external.

schedulingGroupCode.description:
C4542 code of the accessory's scheduling group that combines accessories of the same type and use
(not necessarily the same model or manufacturer but can fullfil the same job requirements).

ownerCompanyNo.description: the number of the company that owns the accessory.

additionalSchedulingGroupCode.description:
list of additional scheduling groups. A scheduling group combines accessories of the same type and use
(not necessarily the same model or manufacturer).

pOBox.description: the post office box of the address. The P.O. Box should be transferred including the country-specific text component. For example, for Switzerland \"Postfach 12\" in England \"PO Box 12\".

additionalLine1.description: Additional line of an address which is neither a street nor a post office box. For example, \"c/o Samuel Schnelli\" or \"Office Samuel Schnelli\".

additionalLine2.description: Extended additional component of an address that is neither a street nor a post office box. For example, \"Floor 12\" or \"Building 15\".

zipCode.description: Zipcode of the address in country-specific format. Mandatory together with the country code and the city. For example, \"EC1A 1AA\" for London, England or \"9500\" for Wil, Switzerland.

applicationEntry.description:
possible values are:
- `B_HTR`: LEVA+
- `B_SE`: Steine + Erden
- `B_TS`: Treibstoff
- `B_WKST`: Werkstatt
applicationEntry.title: ApplicationEntry

application.description: application usage that applies to context (machine / accessory or other records)
application.title: Application

externalBpAddrId.description: External address id of the customer.

origin.description: Origin of the customer (used together with origin id). Customers created in leva+ will have the origin "leva+". They will not have an origin id.

customerId.description: Technical identification number of the customer.

externalCustomerId.description: External id of the customer - set if the customer was created in a third party system.

c3341CustomerStatus.description: Status of the customer. Only customers with the status "33410030 = customer" may be used for orders.

modifyDate.description: Date the entity was last modified.

isConsortium.description: Defines whether or not this customer is a consortium.

companyAccounts.description: List of company accounts this customer is assigned to.

active.description: Is this entry active or not.

companyNo.description: The number of the company that this entry is assigned to.

currency.description: Default currency in ISO 4217 Code (3 digit letter).

cashPayment.description: Defines whether or not the customer pays cash.

privateSurcharge.description: Defines whether or not the customer pays a B2C surcharge.

c4504ChargingType.description: Defines how the customer pays the bill (single or collective invoice).

c4570PriceCategory.description: Defines if a customer has a price category.

chargingBpAddrId.description: Internal address number of the customer which is charged for the services.

chargingExternalBpAddrId.description: External address number of the customer which is charged for the services.

chargingCustomerId.description: External address id of the customer which is charged for the services.

shippingBpAddrId.description: Address number of the customer invoice shipping address.

shippingExternalBpAddrId.description: External address number of the customer invoice shipping address.

yourRef.description: Default reference of the customer. Is printed on the invoice.

customerSalesReward.description: Sales reward programm for customer. Per year, a rate configures the payback reward for the customer.

fileDocumentLink.title: FileDocumentLink
fileDocumentLink.description: provides Id and Guid to a saved file. this structure is used to attach previously saved attachments to the application context. e.g. a photo made on a mobile device is saved to performis and then attached to a job as a job document.

fileDocumentGuid.description: internal Guid of document. Must be provided together with document Id for verification purposes.

counterTypeCode.description: C4548 code of the counter type used in the machine, e.g. km, hours of operation.

account.description: Account to post the counters against.

driverBpId.description: Business partner ID of the driver.

externalDriverBpId.description: External business partner ID of the driver - may be used instead of DriverBpId.

machineId.description: Internal technical key for the machine.

externalMachineId.description: External technical key for machine - may be used instead of MachineId.

active.description: Sets whether or not the machine may be used in LEVA+.

description.description: Description (e.g. name, type, number) of the machine.

placingOnMarket.description: Date when the machine was first registered and used in the business. Important for service dates etc.

externalMachineTypeId.description:
External identification number for MachineType
- may be used instead of the MachineTypeId.

machineGUId.description: Unique identifier for a machine. Used for communication with third party systems.

machineNo.description: Identification number for a single machine.

acquisitionDate.description: The date the machine was acquired.

manufacturerCode.description: C4543 code of the machine manufacturer.

masterNumber.description: A master number is used to assign and identify the vehicle.

typeCertificateNumber.description: Official number for identification of the vehicle type by external entities.

externalOwnerBpAddrId.description: External address number of the owner.

externalLocationBpAddrId.description: External address number of the location.

invoiceBpAddrId.description: Address number of the customer to invoice.

externalInvoiceBpAddrId.description: External address number of the customer to invoice.

regularDriverBpId.description: Business partner ID of the regular driver.

externalRegularDriverBpId.description: External business partner ID of the regular driver.

counterGroupCode.description: C4546 code of the counter group.

standardTrailerMachineId.description: The identification number of the semi-trailer that is usually coupled with this machine.

externalStandardTrailerMachineId.description: The external identification number of the semi-trailer that is usually coupled with this machine.

machineModelCode.description: C4541 code of the machine model, e.g. crane.

branchCode.description: C4562 identification code of the branch to which the machine belongs.

isExternalResource.description: Is this machine an external resource?

yearOfManufacture.description: The year in which the machine was built.

schedulingGroupCode.description: C4542 code of the machine disposition type.

locationApiKey.description: API key to access location service for the machine.

isMachineLocationSyncEnabled.description: Whether or not the machines location is automatically synced.

manufacturerApiCode.description: C3306 code of the used location API connector.

engineType.description: What type of engine does the machine have.

costCenterNo.description: Number of the cost center this machine is billed internally to.

telematicsDeviceGroupCode.description: C3336 code defining which telematics system the machine uses.

lastYearlyService.description: Date of the machine's last yearly service.

typeOfDrives.description: List of type of drives of the machine.

schedulingGroups.description:
List of additional disposition groups. A disposition group combines machines of the same type and use
(not necessarily the same model or manufacturer). (E.g. a 20m boom, might be sold as 12m boom).

machineDrivers.description: List of the business partner Ids of the driver/s that can use this machine.

machineCounters.description: List of counters of the machine.

machineUsages.description: List of applications this machine is used in.

machineTypeId.description: Technical identification of the machine type.

externalMachineTypeId.description: External identification of the machine type - may be used instead of the MachineTypeId.

active.description: Is the machine type active or not?

description.description: Name or designation of the associated machine type.

manufacturerSeries.description: Which machine type series does the machine belong to?

externalSuppliersBusinessBpAddrId.description: External address number of the supplier.

maintenanceWindow.title: MaintenanceWindow
maintenanceWindow.description: information structure for active maintenance windows

active.description: usually the API will respond with this structure, when the maintenance window is active and the window has started.

clientStartAllowed.description: defines wether or not clients may continue to work while the maintenance window applies.

projectStructure.description: The project structure that describes a general project. Projects may originate from various sources.
projectStructure.title: ProjectStructure

active.description: Is this entity active or not.

modifyUser.description: User which modified the entity last.

modifyDate.description: Date the entity was last modified.

description.description: Title of the project or order.

customerId.description: Customer id of the project or order.

externalCustomerId.description: External customer id of the project or order.

currency.description: Currency in ISO 4217 Code (3 digit letter).

startDate.description: Start date of the project or order.

endDate.description: End date of the project or order.

parent.description: Identifikation string of the parent object. If the object is the root - no parent is given.

projectStructureType.description: Defines what type the entry is. While projects are only structural and will never have cost directly associated, orders are used to render services and charge assigned customer. It is possible to create an order without assigning it to a parent project.
projectStructureType.title: ProjectStructureType

year.description: The year the sales reward applies to.

rate.description: Rate of the sales reward the customer receives.

salesReward.description: Sales reward program for customer. Per year, a rate configures the payback reward for the customer.
salesReward.title: SalesReward

schedulingGroupCode.description:
C4542 code of the machine grouping that combines machines of the same type and use
(not necessarily the same model or manufacturer).

signature.description: signature details when available. If not provided: a report, handover or return is considered un-signed.
signature.title: Signature

signatureId.description: signature Id. leave empty when creating a new signature entry.

signeeName.description: Person who is signing the document. Preferably full name.

surchargeId.description: internal unique identifier for surcharge master data entry

externalSurchargeId.description: external unique identifier for surcharge master data entry

priceUnitOfMeasure.description: unit of measure in which quantities for must be submitted

sortNo.description: a sort number order of the surcharge when being displayed (ascending)

suggestedQuantity.description: a quantity in PriceUnitOfMeasure that is usually suggested for this surcharge, so that users must not manually input common a common quantity

suggestedOnRentalHandover.description: wether or not this surcharge is suggested on rental handovers (e.g. additional instruction or placement)

suggestedOnRentalReturn.description: wether or not this surcharge is suggested on rental returns (e.g. cleaning)

typeOfDrive.description:
Typ of drive values.
- `B`: Petrol
- `H`: Hybrid
- `D`: Diesel
- `E`: Electric
typeOfDrive.title: TypeOfDrive

job.title: Job
job.description:
job can be of any type (rental, transport, service, ...)
NOTE: may include or exclude the Details subset based on property DetailsIncluded.

companyNo.description: the number of the company that this entry is assigned to

jobId.description: Job ID of performis / leva+. will be set internally - leave empty if not known.

changeDate.description: date of last change on job

reportEmailReceivers.description:
; or , seperated string of e-mail addresses to receive a report copy.

Note: these addresses are set in the order header and proposed to receive a report copy. Wether or not they actually receive a report copy, is controlled by the ReportEMailNotifications submitted with the report.

employeeId.description: internal employee ID to which the job is assigned to

jobDateTimeFrom.description: scheduled start date and time for this job

jobDateTimeTo.description: scheduled end date and time for this job

resourceNo.description:
the resource demand number to which this job is assigned to.

each order can have multiple resource demands. they are numbered 0001 onwards and are unique within the order. (similar to order-line position no., but for resource demands)

schedulingGroupCode.description:
Code 4542
use IF2BA to retrieve value list.

jobStatusCode.description:
Code 4555
use IF2BA to retrieve value list.

resourceTypeCode.description:
Code 4550
use IF2BA to retrieve value list.

resourceStatusCode.description:
Code 4554
use IF2BA to retrieve value list.

machineId.description: internal maschine ID assigned to job

externalMachineId.description: external machine ID assigned to job

accessoryId.description: internal accessory ID assigned to job

externalAccessoryId.description: external accessory ID assigned to job

useCaseCode.description:
Code 6951
use IF2BA to retrieve value list.

jobDetails.title: JobDetails
jobDetails.description:
detail information on a job such as scheduled activities, contacts and locations.
NOTE: may be empty if not specifically requested (see Job request parameters and properties)

jobScheduleId.description: the unique internal identifier for this job schedule entry.

jobId.description: the internal unique identifier for the job onto which the time stamp is assigned

sortNo.description: number for sorting of the job schedule entries from low to high (ascending)

description.description: activity, task or milestone of the schedule

isOccupied.description:
set to true for as long as the resource is occupied.
when set to false, the resource is still booked for the remainder of the job but marked as available on the planning board.

jobContact.title: JobContact
jobContact.description: a job contact such as "Contact on Site", "Project Manager", (...) and contact information

jobId.description: the unique identifier for the job onto which the contact is assigned

description.description: description or type of the contact (e.g. "project manager")

isCustomer.description: if the contact is the actual customer or not (other party)

isContactOnLocation.description: set to true if the contact is supposed to be on site/location.

jobBookingActivity.title: JobBookingActivity
jobBookingActivity.description: job booking activity are the available activities such as "Loading", "Unloading", (...) which an employee is able to choose from when adding timestamps on the job.

bookingActivityId.description: unique booking activity. other jobs containend the same activity do not have the same job booking activity id.

activityCode.description:
Code 4557.
use IF2BA to retrieve code values for activities.

activity.description:
Text of activity if specified.

NOTE: this may contain free-text for the activity. if the job requires a special activity e.g. "Assist customer on demand" a planner might replace the regular activity text with anything else (non-translated custom input)

active.description: usually set to true. if set to false, the booking activity has been revoked from the job and the employee should no longer be able to submit timestamps on that activity.

jobTimeStamp.title: JobTimeStamp
jobTimeStamp.description:
job time stamp describes who (employee), which resource (machine or accessory), what activity (booking activity), when (timestamp). timestamps form a chronological order from which the effective efforts can be calculated from.

if no job time stamps are provided, there are no recorded efforts on the job and the job status can not be determined.

NOTE: job time stamps may differ from job report timestamps. (job time stamps reflect the internal efforts, while job report timestamps reflect the efforts that the customer will be billed for). Ideally: they match. The reality is, that the backend clerks may be forced to adjust the report quantities to correct various issues (e.g. misheaps)

example1.comment: took longer than expected due to mess at the construction site

jobTimestampId.description: The unique identifier for the job timestamp.

jobId.description: The unique identifier for the job onto which the time stamp is assigned

timestamp.description: The timestamp associated with the job.

bookingActivityId.description: The identifier for resource booking activity.

externalMachineId.description: The external unique identifer for the the machine this job time stamp is assigned to

employeeId.description: The internal identifier for the employee.

externalEmployeeId.description: The external unique identifer for the the employee this job time stamp is assigned to

comment.description: A comment associated with the timestamp.
comment.example: took longer than expected due to mess at the construction site

jobReport.title: JobReport
jobReport.description:
job report on a job.
there may be multiple job reports on a single job for different timespans. e.g. daily, weekly or monthly reports.
NOTE: reporting timeframes of two particular reports shall not overlap or they will be marked with an error on the backend.

example1.comment: return was delayed due to traffic jam at our gates > not her fault!

reportTimeStampList.comment: optional remark on activity, such as why something took longer

comment.description: additional comments on the report (usually visible on report) and for backoffice
comment.example: return was delayed due to traffic jam at our gates > not her fault!

jobReportTimeStamp.title: JobReportTimeStamp
jobReportTimeStamp.description:
job report time stamp entry that forms the reported amount of efforts on a job.

NOTE: these entries may differ from job time stamps. they form the amount of effort that are transfered back to the order billing. In some instances they may be different from the actual time stamps that were made on the job.

example1.comment: optional remark on activity, such as why something took longer

jobReportTimestampId.description: The unique identifier for the job report timestamp.

reportId.description: The unique identifier for the report onto which the time stamp is assigned

timestamp.description: The timestamp associated with the job.

bookingActivityId.description: The identifier for resource booking activity.

comment.description: A comment associated with the timestamp.
comment.example: optional remark on activity, such as why something took longer

jobLocation.title: JobLocation
jobLocation.description: location information for leva+ (address, additional information such as restrictions, ect.)

example1.transportRestriction: limited height 4.5 meteres at gate 3, prefer gate 4 (no height limit)

transportRestriction.description: optional transport restriction information as text
transportRestriction.example: limited height 4.5 meteres at gate 3, prefer gate 4 (no height limit)

jobReportSurcharge.title: JobReportSurcharge
jobReportSurcharge.description: job report (surcharge) defines the surcharge from master data, which is reported on the job.

reportSurchargeId.description: unique identifier for the job report surcharge

jobSurchargeId.description:
unique identifier for the job surcharge

NOTE: refers to the job surcharge that has already been submitted on the job. If this is set, it means that the submitted surcharge on the job is also reported.

that way, the backend can mark the surcharge as "reported with report xy". otherwise the surcharge on the job may be left without a report link and could therefor be seen as "not yet reported".

reportId.description: report ID on which this surcharge is reported

dateTime.description: date and time when the report surcharge was added

assignment.description: assigns the surcharge to a specific job process step.

quantity.description: reported quantity in unit of measure of surcharge master data

jobReportEMailNotification.title: JobReportEMailNotification
jobReportEMailNotification.description:
job report e-mail notification entry which containers a receiver for a job report.
the entry is created and submitted with the job report. the backend can process report pdf generation and automatically sends out the report pdf to the receiver given by this entry. It will then be updated with a Sender and sendDateTime when processed.

If you already sent out the notification, you may submit this entry with sender and sendDateTime in order for the backend to acknoledge that.

reportId.description: unique identifier for the report onto which the notification is assigned

sender.description: a string that contains information about the sender of the notification (only filled, when notification has been successfully sent, otherwise empty). typically an e-mail address like no-reply@mydomain.com

sendDateTime.description: date and time of sent notification (only when successfully sent, otherwise empty)

createDateTime.description: Date and time when the notification was added

createdByemployeeId.description: internal employee ID who added this notification entry

createdByExternalEmployeeId.description: external employee id who added this notification entry

modifyDateTime.description: date and time of modification of the notification entry (in case it is updated later)

modifiedByEmployeeId.description: internal employee id who last modified the entry (in case it is updated later e.g. on backend)

modifiedByExternalEmployeeId.description: external employee id who last modified the entry (in case it is updated later e.g. on backend)

jobHandover.title: JobHandOver
jobHandover.description: a handover for a rental job. confirms that the resource (machine / accessory) has been handed over to the customer. Additional information such as a comment and signature can be supplied.

example1.comment: customer already knows the machine very well

handoverId.description: unique identifier for the hand over

jobId.description: id of the job onto which this handover is assigned to

employeeId.description: internal unique identifer of the employee that made this handover

externalEmployeeId.description: external unique identifer of the employee that made this handover

handoverCompletedDateTime.description:
date and time at which the handover is completed.

NOTE: this timestamp typically marks the actual beginning of the rental period.

customerBriefed.description: wether or not the customer was explicitly briefed on the machine/accessory

comment.description: any remarks made by employee that should be noted on this handover
comment.example: customer already knows the machine very well

jobReturn.title: JobReturn
jobReturn.description: a return for a rental job. confirms that the resource (machine / accessory) has been returned / picked up. Additional information such as a comment or wether or not the resource has been damaged is submitted.

example1.comment: very good condition, customer cleaned it and even replaced a missing screen wiper!

jobId.description: unique id of job onto which this return is assigned

employeeId.description: internal employee id who made the return

externalEmployeeId.description: external employee id who made the return

returnStartedDateTime.description:
actual date time at which the return process started

NOTE: this typically marks the end of a rental period.

jobEndDateTime.description:
actual job end date of the rental

NOTE: this could be preceeding the returnStartedDateTime, for example when the rental is left at the return on the evening prior and no employee was able to retrieve it

damage.description: set when a damage is noticed on return

comment.description: any additional information noted by the employee for this return
comment.example: very good condition, customer cleaned it and even replaced a missing screen wiper!

jobCompletion.title: JobCompletion
jobCompletion.description: a completion for a rental job. marks a rental as completed and confirms that there is no further submission of any job data expected (e.g. no further surcharges and all handover, returns and reports are complete)

jobId.description: unique id of job onto which this return is assigned

completed.description: set when a damage is noticed on return

jobSurcharge.title: JobSurcharge
jobSurcharge.description:
surcharge recorded on a job that is either entered by the employee (e.g. gas refilling in liters) or generated by the system (e.g. overtime surcharge).

NOTE: rental specific surcharges may not be submitted on other service jobs such as crane work or transport.

example1.comment: reason for quantity: additional gas can filled on customers request

jobSurchargeId.description: the unique identifier for this job surcharge

surchargeId.description: unique ID of the surcharge (master data)

assignment.description: assigns the surcharge to a specific job process step.

quantity.description: quantity in price unit of measure given by the base-surcharge

comment.description: optional comment by the employee who submitted the surcharge
comment.example: reason for quantity: additional gas can filled on customers request

reportId.description:
report id which contains this surcharge entry. surcharges are generally created during the entire job process. reports collect them for invoicing. if a surcharge is not assigned to a report, it is not considered for billing.

When the job surcharge id is provided on job report creation, report ID field will be filled by the back end.

jobProblem.title: JobProblem
jobProblem.description:
on a job problem specific conditions or issues related to the resource (machine / accessory) are stored.
they may be submitted in the initial job to clarify existing issues that can be mentioned on handover, or additional job problems are submitted during handover or return to better clarify wether or not something is caused by the customer.

example1.description: various impact dents on the left front side

jobId.description: unique identifier for the job on which this problem is assigned to

description.description: title and or description of the problem
description.example: various impact dents on the left front side

impactOnConditionBool.description:
wether or not the problem is a condition of the resource.

conditions will be transfered noted on the machine / accessory and can furthermore be passed onto future rentals.

visibleForCustomerBool.description: wether or not the problem is visible for the customer.

customersFaultBool.description: wether or not the problem was caused by the customer and actually is customers fault

comment.description: any further commend / description on the problem

solvedBool.description: marked if the problem has been solved

reportedDateTime.description: date and time at which the problem is noted

reportingContext.description: during which context (process) the problem has been noted.

reportingContextText.description: Addition context information (e.g. reported by mobile device)

fixRequiredBool.description:
wether or not the problem requires an fix

problems that require a fix will leave a notification on the resource and is visible on the planning board

jobDocument.title: JobDocument
jobDocument.description: an existing document linked to the job

jobDocumentId.description: unique id of this job document assignment. note: this is not the document id, but the assignment of a document to a job

jobId.description: unique identifier for the job on which this document is assigned to

jobTransportPosition.title: JobTransportPosition
jobTransportPosition.description: job transport positions clarifies what, how much, needs to go where and when.

transportDemandPositionId.description: internal unique id for this job transport demand

unitOfMeasure.description: UoM in wich the quantity is transported

decimalCount.description: amount of decimals in quantity allowed for this UoM

loadedQuantity.description: loaded quantity can be different from the demand. use-case is under or over-delivery

unloadedQuantity.description: unloaded quantity can be different from the demand. use-case is under or over-delivery

loadingCompleted.description: checkmark wether or not loading has been completed.

unloadingCompleted.description: checkmark wether or not unloading has been completed.

rentalJobId.description: is set, when the current transport demand (assigned resource) points to a rental job.

jobTransportPositionChecklist.title: JobTransportPositionChecklist
jobTransportPositionChecklist.description:
Job transport position checklist clarifies which position has been loaded and or unloaded.
Any transport from point A to B contains a loading and unloading checkmark that can be set by the user.

transportPositionId.description: internal unique id for this job transport position

loadingCompleted.description: checkmark wether or not loading has been completed.

unloadingCompleted.description: checkmark wether or not unloading has been completed.
